intro: Miersia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed miersia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Miersia triloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
